p: For A. sylvaticus at San Agustin, the inverse relationship with mean temperature was selected as the most parsimonious model for abundance ( Table 2). However, a positive relationship with rainfall and the number of extremely hot days could not be ruled out (ΔAICc < 2). Based on the lowest AICc model, we estimated the mean abundance for each sampling year that varied between a minimum of 2.05 individuals ( SE = 1.55; Temperature = 16.86 °C) and a maximum of 4.95 individuals ( SE = 3.971; Temperature = 15.19 °C) ( Figure 3).
